Reviews.Content: For the money, it does exactly what I need it to do. Better range than I thought. Just a little blurry at night.

Reviews.Title: Good in the daylight but,
Reviews.Author: richard
Reviews.Content: IR pictures really fail.  Mostly smoke and clouds.  Near worthless!  No, make that totally worthless!Otherwise, very easy to set-up and use. would be nice if you could plug it direct to the PC to retrive pictures.

Reviews.Title: good low budget cam
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera for the price. Camera shot nice pictures of raccoon, porcupines, squirrels, birds, black bears, and deer.  Just enough for you to tell what it is. I give a 4 stars because even though I don't expect great quality photos from a camera at this price, I think it should be labeled as a 3MP instead of 5MP.

Reviews.Title: infrared doesn't always work
Reviews.Author: Jacob Ross
Reviews.Content: The camera takes nice daytime pics and triggers at almost anything but all my night pics are black I'm not a fan of infrared I'm gonna go back to a flash camera

Reviews.Title: Compact, affordable, but not right for me
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Edelman
Reviews.Content: The Moultrie A-5 has a lot going for it. It's inexpensive, it's from a good company, and tests I've read say it has good resolution and good range. My problem is with the range of available settings, particularly the "delay" setting, which sets the minimum interval between photos. The A-5 allows delay settings of 1, 5, 10, or 30 minutes, and that's not short enough for my purposes;  My application is actually home security, not monitoring game. I was looking for something that I could dial down to 5 seconds or less in order to be able to capture multiple images of someone who might just be checking for unlocked doors. .If you're looking for a budget trail camera, and you don't have a problem with the limited range of delay settings, the A-5 is a pretty good deal. It just didn't fit my needs.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pics
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Goen
Reviews.Content: I replaced older Moultrie flash cameras with these Infrared units. Every week I post my deer pictures on face book, and have had two friends comment on the quality of the pictures. The cool part about that is, is that I have the settings on the worst quality picture it will take. I do that to save on batteries, and its still taking great pictures. I highly recommend these especially when you consider the price.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says it will do!
Reviews.Author: Steve Cook "Web Design Austin"
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this little gem yesterday and have been having tons of fun capturing game shots.  After reading the instruction booklet I've put this camera through all it's paces and tested every possible condition and setting - works perfectly.  Infra-red photos are too cool.  For under $75 I'm guessing this is the very best option that could possibly exist.  I'm 100% satisfied and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Poor poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Goatherd
Reviews.Content: After the first time I changed out the SD card in the camera it never took another photo.  So far I've left three requests for help on their "contact us" form on the Moultrie website.  No response whatsoever.  Despite the hopeful "We'll get back to you shortly." message you get when you hit submit.There is no mention of how to check battery life in the field though the battery indicator light is on, whatever that means.  It's not mentioned in the manual.  There is no FAQ section for this camera on their site.  I've changed the batteries out anyway, but the ones from the camera I brought back to the house read as full charge.No response to customer service requests.No detailed instructions on troubleshooting in the manual.No FAQ section on their website.Gonna have to give Moultrie a big F on this one.

Reviews.Title: Camera takes a picture every minute
Reviews.Author: gburg2013
Reviews.Content: This camera takes a picture even when there is nothing in front of it. This thing is just terrible and it does not work. I wind up with a memory card with 4,000 pictures on it of nothing and dead batteries. This thing is a complete waste of 50 bucks, buy a Bushnell or something that works...

Reviews.Title: Terrible product
Reviews.Author: Brett spann
Reviews.Content: Put new batteries in it! Very tight and difficult to put in and remove!! Almost damages the springs in the process!! Also it didn't work at all!! Called tech support!' New batteries at their request! Nope extra money still not working!! Ask trch if I can use the power adapter port if I matched it correctly!! Uh nope not recommended!!! Thank god for amazon and prime I decided they can keep it!! Oh and I left my SD card in it darn !' No one called to return it either !!'

Reviews.Title: Failed my expectations!
Reviews.Author: Wolfeden
Reviews.Content: Having researched "Trail Cams", I decided on the Moultrie A5 because it was relatively inexpensive.  I planned to use it in my backyard to see what was visiting at night.  After setting it up and trying a couple of daytime shots, I was pleased with the quality.  However, the flash did not work and I got no pictures after dark.

Reviews.Title: doesn't work
Reviews.Author: vicky richardson
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a christmas gift for my husband, and it doesn't work.  I would not recommend this product to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: rob chernak
Reviews.Content: Takes good pics.  The trigger speed is nice and short, you can definitely depend on it to take your scouting pictures

Reviews.Title: Picture ok
Reviews.Author: George hall
Reviews.Content: Pictures ok over feeder but after importing pictures to iPad  ,they are reversed and distortedNo response from Moultrie  would not buy again

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Diane Humiston
Reviews.Content: Didn't take night time photosNo trouble shooting pageNot very good directions..should I use High or Low?Distance,How to use SD card in the computer

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: MNGal
Reviews.Content: Don't bother with this camera.  It's been up for 3 weeks and has captured 11 TOTAL photos in front of a deer feeder that has daily and nightly activity.  NO nighttime photos have been captured.  Verified multiple times that settings are correct and the camera is placed within an acceptable distance of the target.  This camera simply does not deliver on what it says it should.  Complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Looks like what I was expecting.
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: It looks to be just what I was looking for. I have not set it up as yet and probably will not do so for several months, But at this point from what I see I'm sure it will do what I desire.

Reviews.Title: Bad News
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Received camera and it does not work. I have tried everything I know to do in order to make it work. I am going to box it up and return for replacement.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: valerie kokosinski
Reviews.Content: same again.  gift for someone.  hope he enjoys it and it works for whatever he has intentions for it. Hunting

Reviews.Title: Poor quality photos
Reviews.Author: Barbara L.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that would help me identify creatures visiting my backyard at night. I placed the Moultrie in a position that would show animals coming to my birdfeeder and birdbath. After about a week, I looked at the photos (there were well over 1,000) and found that the quality was so poor that it was difficult to tell who the visitors were. I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: price was right
Reviews.Author: diane
Reviews.Content: Have not used the prduct yet. Got for xmas and the weather has not let me out to set it up???

Reviews.Title: Nice product for the price!
Reviews.Author: Martin Silveira
Reviews.Content: I had performed a quick try of the camera, and the images (especially night ones) are very clear. The best part is that you cant see a glow at all, you can only see the red bulbs turn on, but as long as you are not looking straight at it, you wont realize. The image and video quality are not bad at all, considering the low price. The only con, it the trigger is not that fast, when the camera captures movement, it takes a few secs to take pictures or video, but is not a big issue.To round things up:What I like:*Nice size, easy to set up*Good image and video quality (as long the target stays within 10m away from the camera, especially at night)*Security integrated (you can put a chain and a padlock to secure it to a tree or pole, or buy a python lock). Also you can lock the camera, so none can access the setup buttons and take out the memory card.*No glow is seen, only the red bulbs, but you wont see them if you are not lokking staright at them. This wotn scare the animals, as a regular flash.What I dont like:*Picture and video delay can be set, but the shortest option is 1 minute. It would be great to have for 30 sec, to capture quick action*No field scan whatsoever (this is not an issue, for the low price of the camera)*A quickest trigger will be best*Im not sure that rain isolation is good to face heavy rain. (I didnt try it under the rain)I recommend this camera, but ig you need more customize options or further features, this will not be the best one (other cameras will cost more than 100 bucks, so if you are a hunter on a budget, this is the right choise).Just follow the instructions and you wont have issues. Ive seen bad revies on the web for this product, but if you make a good use, it will last.
